alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 8:18PM CDT until April 10 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. .Rainfall has ended in the basin but River levels continue to rise here and on upstream tributaries such as Sandies Creek. The river is expected to crest just above Minor Flood Stage Sunday and fall back below flood stage by Sunday evening. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River Near Cuero. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor low lying flooding extends into the floodplain above and below Cuero. Steen Road (between FM 766 and US Hwy 183 near Hochheim) monitored for flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 16.98 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 25.3 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.4 feet on 06/29/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 17.0 Fri 7 pm CDT 20.5 24.1 20.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 9 AM CDT.
